I’m devastated to learn of our injured and Fallen law enforcement officers today in Spring Grove. There are few callings in life whereby you leave for your job and are never really sure if you’ll be able to return home; today is yet another sobering reminder of that.  I’m brokenhearted for these officers, their loved ones, their fellow officers, and the communities they faithfully, tirelessly, and selflessly served.  Please join me in praying for them and our communities.

I’m happy to again host the Congressional App Challenge for PA-10. This competition highlights the STEM and coding skills of our students, and is open to any middle and high school student in our District. 
 
Registration is now open. This is a great competition and I urge our students to participate.  I look forward to seeing more of the great, talented, and very creative entries!

Our Constitution is the reason America is…AMERICA: the freest place on Earth. 

Signed in Pennsylvania 238 years ago in 1787, we celebrate today the miracle of our Founding Fathers to build One Nation Under God upon a document so brilliant that it’s the world’s oldest, surviving,  written constitution still in use, and one that’s used as a model for governments worldwide. 

Though referred to throughout time as such by historians, the Constitution first was called a “miracle” by Madison and Washington to express the reverence and awe at the surprising achievement of a unified framework of government - in the face of deep divisions - and the overall success of the new Republic.

God Bless America.

I am crestfallen. I’m shocked. I’m enraged. I’m frustrated. I feel helpless.  But I’m praying mightily to the Good Lord for Charlie. 

I am praying mightily for his wife and his kids as they even begin to navigate this breathtaking loss.  And I’m praying for the millions of his loved ones that believe in God, our Nation, and everything Charlie fought so mightily for.  

Know that he would never want us to give up.  We must continue to stand strong.  And we must continue to pray to the Lord - for Charlie, and for our Nation.  
 
God bless you, Charlie.  See you on the High Ground, my friend.

I suspect I’m joined by many in finding it difficult to describe my sadness and outrage over the recent murder of an innocent young woman, Iryna Zarutska, in Charlotte, NC recently.  Maybe because she legally emigrated from the violence in Ukraine to a better and more hopeful life in America?  Maybe because she had just gotten off work and was simply on her way home when she literally was slaughtered like an animal by Decarlos Brown Jr.?  Maybe because the mainstream media covered NONE of this until very recently when it started hitting social media – as if her life didn’t matter enough to report it? Maybe because the mayor of Charlotte, NC had the breathtaking audacity to marginalize this horror as simply a "tragic situation…caused by a…lack of  social safety nets." 

Or…all of the above. 

No, Madam Mayor - this “situation” is caused by the abject apathy, negligence, and malfeasance perpetrated by “leaders“ who refuse to uphold the standards of the law and deal with criminals. This individual had been arrested over a dozen times, and diagnosed with schizophrenia. WHY was someone with his record of violence and mental illness free to roam freely and perpetuate more violence?

It’s unacceptable, it’s inexcusable, and no amount of “explanation“ is going to matter to Iryna’s loved ones as they try to navigate this devastation. I pray for her and them, and I ask you to join me. 

Our elected leaders need to wake up and do what they were elected to do: LEAD AND PROTECT.

Every suicide is heartbreaking. Perhaps even closer to my heart are ones committed by our Veterans - who have a 57% higher suicide rate and account for 14% of all adult suicides in the US. 

Please stay engaged with and aware of people around you who may be struggling; simply asking if they’re okay or need help might just make the difference they need.  Likewise, never be afraid to ask for help yourself - there are so many people and resources ready and available to you to guide you through the darkness.

This is amazing news - especially for the loved ones of the guy that was brutally and randomly murdered, and whose death has caused breathtaking pain for so many still trying to make sense of it all.

It’s going to continue - everywhere - until we pursue violent crime and hold criminals to the standards of the law.

Today, 242 years ago, the Treaty of Paris was signed by American and British dignitaries, officially ending the Revolutionary War. America was represented by three great patriots: John Adams, John Jay, and Pennsylvania's own Benjamin Franklin. In signing the treaty, Great Britain formally recognized the independence and boundaries of the United States. The Treaty of Paris doubled the size of America's borders, secured crucial fighting rights, and hammered out key details for settling debts. After this day, the United States has been free, sovereign, and independent.
YES. Claw back globalist funding and return it to the Treasury (The People).  This is an important step from globalism towards sanity.

In 2021, the USAF properly identified the Army’s Redstone Arsenal in Huntsville AL - our “mecca” for space and air tech - as the best location for the new U.S. Space Command HQ. 
 
In 2023, President Biden made the (solely political)  decision to move it to CO - without the least regard for national security, cost, or efficiency.  

Thanks to POTUS, Space Command is going back where it belongs:  Redstone.

On September 2, 1945, Imperial Japan formally surrendered to the United States  aboard the USS Missouri, bringing the end of World War II. We’re reminded yet again today of the sacrifices of (and our eternal debt to) “The Greatest Generation” in securing peace and our future liberties and freedom.

In 1993, Eddie York was gunned down on his first day on the job by a mob of United Mine Workers Union picketers. His offense? Not belonging to the union. Reprehensibly, the individuals who murdered him were never brought to justice due to inaction by state and local officials and the "Enmons Loophole," in which the Supreme Court butchered the federal Hobbs Anti-Extortion Act to legalize violence and extortion by union members.
 
My bill, the ‘Freedom from Union Violence Act,’ ensures that the Hobbs Anti-Extortion Act applies equally to all Americans. Eddie - and hundreds of other workers murdered by union members - should be alive today.

On this date in 2021, 13 United States Service Members (and 170 civilians) were murdered by terrorist cowards at Abbey Gate in Kabul while helping civilians quickly evacuate as the US began a disastrous withdrawal from Afghanistan. The selfless courage, sacrifice, and service of our Troops that fateful day (and all days) is not forgotten.  May God continue to bless them and their loved ones.
